alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Henderson; Henry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, Benton, eastern Carroll, eastern Henry, east central Chester and Decatur Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Paris Landing State Park to near Jacks Creek. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Paris, Lexington, Camden, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Paris Landing State Park, Parsons, New Johnsonville, Bruceton, Decaturville, Sardis, Reagan, Vale, Wildersville, Springville, Parkers Crossroads, Darden, Montgomery, Scotts Hill and Hollow Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Henderson; Henry
